docs.title: A lightweight RestAPI client that manage food recipies easily
docs.text:
ForkAPI is a Django drf based project which can be easily integrated as a backend service for a mobile application or web application that can display, add, favorite a food recipies. The api is designed to be simple to use with build in Dashboard panel to add recipies manual or using the provided endpoints (views in Django).

You can benefit for future support of the project.

Get Started Installation

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: To install the API you need a Python 3.x installed also venv module and pip. Here will be covered two types of installation for debugging and for production.

docs.title: Mutual Steps
docs.text:
Clone the repository with the command 

$ git clone https://github.com/mikebgrep/forkapi
Rename .env.example to .env In linux 
$ cd forkapi
$ mv .env.example .env
Enter the environment variables in .env file.

  • PAGINATION_PAGE_SIZE is used for pagination used in the API certain endpoint.
  • DJANGO_SECRET you can generate the secret online -> link or with the following command if you have installed django on the machine 
    $ python -c 'from django.core.management.utils import get_random_secret_key; print(get_random_secret_key())'
  • X_AUTH_HEADER also you can generate random UUID online that will be used for authentication for the read only endpoint. Example header 261ec18d-0e81-4073-8d9e-b34a7a1e5e06 (Don`t use it this is for demo purpose)

docs.title: Installing locally (Debug mode)
docs.text:
You can create a virtual environment and click of the API. Note replace the 3.x with actual Python version 

$ python3.x -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate
$ pip install -r requirements.txt

Make the needed migrations so Django can create sqlite database file with tables. 

$ cd forkapi
$ python manage.py makemigrations authentication
$ python manage.py makemigrations recipe
$ python manage.py migrate

At this point everything should be ok, and you can start the server. 

$ python manage.py runserver
You can access the dashboard admin panel on localhost:8000. In this mode you can use it locally if in debug mode which you can change in /forkapi/settings.py file line 27

docs.title: Installing in Docker container (Production)
docs.text:
To installing in Docker container follow the steps bellow. For Raspberry Pi with Raspbian OS make sure to uncomment the packages in the main Dockerfile on line 16

  • First steps is setting up the fullchain.pem and privkey.pem files needed for the ssl settings in nginx used as reverse proxy.
  • After you obtain ssl certificates for your domain you need to copy them in the nginx/ssl folder.
  • Replace the localhost value for server_name on lines 8 and 14 with your actual domain name in the forkapi/forkapi.nginx.conf configuration file.

  • That all you need to run the docker compose command and the API will be deployed on the server instance or locally on your machine. 

    Depends of the available package

$ docker compose up

or 

$ docker-compose up

  • Access the admin dashboard at your-domain:80 or your-domain:443

I will not include steps for setting the domain name servers on this as you can follow the official documentation on your server or the Raspberry Pi documentation.

Follow next step to check how you can and must made your first request.

docs.title: Contribution
docs.text:
Any contribution is welcomed and here the instructions to do so:

  1. Fork the repository
  2. Work on master branch if the changes are not major or create a new branch for major updates
  3. Make your changes and open pull request

Info

For major futures you can open a issue first and then branch that should be named future/name-of-the-change

docs.title: Desired modifications
docs.text:
Note

If you decide to contribute and you have experience with Django a good starting point will be to rework the Django Admin Panel with more fancy look and feel.

docs.title: Make your first request
docs.text:
After the API is deployed you need to create a superuser for the admin dashboard. This can be done ether with Django manage.py python manage.py createsuperuser command or using an API Client as Postman or curl CLI tool.

I will present the method with the curl as more convenient method but you can use and Postman.

docs.title: Creating superuser
docs.text:
To create a superuser for login into the Admin Dashboard use the following curl command in you terminal or powershell.

curl --location --request POST --header "Content-type: application/json" --header "X-Auth-Header: X_AUTH_HEADER"  --data-raw '{"username":"your-username","password":"you-password", "is_superuser": true}' 'https://your-domain-name/api/auth/signup'
Take a note that you need to change

  • X_AUTH_HEADER with the value from .env file
  • your-username and your-password with valid data
  • https://your-domain-name with actual domain name

When you execute the curl command the admin user will be created you can log in to the admin dashboard from the base url of the api (the domain name).

docs.title: On this page you can check the RestAPI endpoints.
docs.text:
Note

The API has build in csrf protection you may need to attach Cookie with value csrftoken=token to work proparly

docs.title: Create admin user
docs.text: POST /api/auth/signup

docs.title: Payload
Headers
docs.text: name type data type description X-Auth-Header required UUID Header used for authentication with the API

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 201 application/json User created successfully 400 application/json {"username":["user with this username already exists."]}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location 'host/api/auth/signup' --header 'X-Auth-Header: X_AUTH_HEADER' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data '{"username":"username","password":"password","is_superuser":true}'

docs.title: Obtain access token
docs.text: POST /api/auth/token

docs.title: Payload
Headers
docs.text: name type data type description X-Auth-Header required UUID Header used for authentication with the API

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 200 application/json {"token":"token","user":{"username":"username","is_superuser":true}} 404 application/json {"detail":"No User matches the given query."} 403 application/json {"detail": "You must use authentication header"}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: `curl --location 'host/api/auth/token' --header 'X-Auth-Header: X_AUTH_HEADER' --header 'Content-Type: application/json' --data '{"username":"username","password":"password"}''

docs.title: Search for recipes
docs.text: GET /api/recipe/home/

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: name type data type description name query (optional) string Part or fulll name of the recipe.Recipe object page query (optional) int Page number if there a mutilple pages result

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: name type data type description X-Auth-Header required UUID Header used for authentication with the API

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 200 application/json {"count":int,"next":string,"previous":string,"results":[recipe.Recipe obj list]} 403 application/json {"detail":"You must use authentication header"}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location 'http://host:port/api/recipe/home/?name=name&page=1' --header 'X-Auth-Header: X_AUTH_HEADER

docs.title: Get favorite recipes
docs.text: GET /api/recipe/home/favorites

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: name type data type description X-Auth-Header required UUID Header used for authentication with the API

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 200 application/json {"count":int,"next":string,"previous":string,"results":[recipe.Recipe obj list]} 404 application/json {"detail":"No Recipe matches the given query."} 403 application/json {"detail":"You must use authentication header"}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location 'http://host:port/api/recipe/home/favorites/' --header 'X-Auth-Header: X_AUTH_HEADER

docs.title: Get trending recipes
docs.text: GET /api/recipe/trending

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: name type data type description X-Auth-Header required UUID Header used for authentication with the API

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 200 application/json [recipe.Recipe objects list] 403 application/json {"detail":"You must use authentication header"}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location 'localhost:8080/api/recipe/trending' --header 'X-Auth-Header: X_AUTH_HEADER

docs.title: Update favorite status
docs.text: PATCH /api/recipe/int:pk/favorite

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: name type data type description <int:pk> path (required) int Recipe primary key to be favorited or unfavorited

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: name type data type description Authorization required Access Token Token obtained from login endpoint example "token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900"

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 201 application/json "Success favorite recipe" 201 application/json "Success unfavorite recipe" 403 application/json `{"detail":"You must use authentication header"} 404 application/json Not Found

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location --request PATCH 'host/api/recipe/1/favorite' --header 'X-Auth-Header: X_AUTH_HEADER'

docs.title: Create recipe
docs.text: POST /api/recipe/

docs.title: Payload
docs.text:
recipe.Recipe object
{
    "image": file,
    "name": string,
    "serves": int,
    "video": file (optional),
    "category": <int:pk>,
    "tag": <int:pk>,
    "prep_time": int,
}

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: name type data type description Authorization required Access Token Token obtained from login endpoint example "token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900" Content-Type multipart/form-data Recipe object Recipe multipart/form-data object

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 201 application/json {recipe.Recipe object} 400 application/json {"tag":["Incorrect type. message"]} 401 application/json {"detail":"Authentication credentials were not provided."}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location 'localhost:8080/api/recipe/'  --header 'Authorization: Token d8916a5f6cf16d2c6a87bc7461bc4680245609f0' --form 'image=@"/path/image.jpg"' --form 'name="Test recipe creation"' --form 'serves="5"' --form 'category="1"' --form 'tag=1' --form 'prep_time="45"'

docs.title: Update recipe main info (without ingredients and steps)
docs.text: PUT /api/recipe/int:pk

docs.title: Payload
docs.text:
recipe.Recipe object
{
    "image": file,
    "name": string,
    "serves": int,
    "video": file (optional),
    "category": <int:pk>,
    "tag": <int:pk>,
    "prep_time": int,
}

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: name type data type description <int:pk> path (required) int Recipe primary key to be updated

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: name type data type description Authorization required Access Token Token obtained from login endpoint example "token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900" Content-Type multipart/form-data Recipe object Recipe multipart/form-data object

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 200 application/json {recipe.Recipe object} 400 application/json {"tag":["Incorrect type. message"]} 401 application/json {"detail":"Authentication credentials were not provided."}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location --request PUT 'host/api/recipe/1' --header 'Authorization: Token d8916a5f6cf16d2c6a87bc7461bc4680245609f0' --form 'image=@"/path/image.jpg"' --form 'name="Update name"' --form 'serves="4"' --form 'category="1"' --form 'tag="1"' --form 'prep_time="21"'

docs.title: Get all categories
docs.text: GET /api/recipe/trending

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: name type data type description X-Auth-Header required UUID Header used for authentication with the API

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 200 application/json [recipe.Category objects list] 403 application/json {"detail":"You must use authentication header"}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location 'host/api/recipe/category' --header 'X-Auth-Header: X_AUTH_HEADER'

docs.title: Get all categories recipes
docs.text: GET /api/recipe/category/int:pk/recipes

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: name type data type description <int:pk> path (required) int Category primary key

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: name type data type description X-Auth-Header required UUID Header used for authentication with the API

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 200 application/json [recipe.Recipe objects list] 403 application/json {"detail":"You must use authentication header"}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location 'host/api/recipe/category/1/recipes' --header 'X-Auth-Header: X_AUTH_HEADER'

docs.title: Create category
docs.text: POST /api/recipe/category/add

docs.title: Payload
Headers
docs.text: name type data type description Authorization required Access Token Token obtained from login endpoint example "token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900" Content-Type application/json `Applicaton Json content header

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 201 application/json {recipe.Category object} 400 application/json {"tag":["Incorrect type. message"]} 401 application/json {"detail":"Authentication credentials were not provided."}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location 'host/api/recipe/category/add' --header 'Authorization: token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900' --data '{"name":"Greek"}'

docs.title: Update category
docs.text: PUT /api/recipe/category/int:pk

docs.title: Payload
Parameters
docs.text: name type data type description <int:pk> path (required) int Category primary key

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: name type data type description Authorization required Access Token Token obtained from login endpoint example "token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900" Content-Type application/json `Applicaton Json content header

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 200 application/json {recipe.Recipe object} 401 application/json {"detail":"Authentication credentials were not provided."} 404 application/json {"detail":"No Category matches the given query."}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location --request PUT 'host/api/recipe/category/6' --header 'Authorization: token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900'  --header 'Content-Type: application/json'  --data '{"name":"Italiano"}'

docs.title: Get all tags
docs.text: GET /api/recipe/tags

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: name type data type description X-Auth-Header required UUID Header used for authentication with the API

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 200 application/json [recipe.Tag objects list] 403 application/json {"detail":"You must use authentication header"}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location 'host/api/recipe/tags' --header 'X-Auth-Header: X_AUTH_HEADER'

docs.title: Get all recipes from tag
docs.text: GET /api/recipe/tag/int:pk/recipes

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text: name type data type description <int:pk> path (required) int Tag primary key

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: name type data type description X-Auth-Header required UUID Header used for authentication with the API

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 200 application/json {"count":int,"next":string,"previous":string,"results":[recipe.Recipe obj list]} 403 application/json {"detail":"You must use authentication header"}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location 'host/api/recipe/tag/<int:pk>/recipes' --header 'X-Auth-Header: X_AUTH_HEADER'

docs.title: Create tag
docs.text: POST /api/recipe/tag/add

docs.title: Payload
Headers
docs.text: name type data type description Authorization required Access Token Token obtained from login endpoint example "token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900" Content-Type application/json `Applicaton Json content header

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 201 application/json {recipe.Category object} 400 application/json {"tag":["Incorrect type. message"]} 401 application/json {"detail":"Authentication credentials were not provided."}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location 'host/api/recipe/tag/add' --header 'Authorization: token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900' --data '{"name":"Summer vibes"}'

docs.title: Update tag
docs.text: PUT /api/recipe/tag/int:pk

docs.title: Payload
Parameters
docs.text: name type data type description <int:pk> path (required) int Tag primary key

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: name type data type description Authorization required Access Token Token obtained from login endpoint example "token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900" Content-Type application/json `Applicaton Json content header

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 200 application/json {recipe.Tag object} 401 application/json {"detail":"Authentication credentials were not provided."} 404 application/json {"detail":"No Category matches the given query."}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location --request PUT 'host/api/recipe/tag/1' --header 'Authorization: token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900'  --header 'Content-Type: application/json'  --data '{"name":"Summer Vibes"}'

docs.title: Ingredients
docs.text: POST /api/recipe/int:pk/ingredients

docs.title: Payload
Parameters
docs.text: name type data type description <int:pk> path (required) int Recipe primary key to which to link the ingredients

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: name type data type description Authorization required Access Token Token obtained from login endpoint example "token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900" Content-Type application/json `Applicaton Json content header

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 201 application/json [{recipe.Ingrediant object}] 400 application/json {"tag":["Incorrect type. message"]} 401 application/json {"detail":"Authentication credentials were not provided."}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location 'host/api/recipe/ingredients' --header 'Authorization: token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900' --data '[{"name":"Kasher salt","quantity":"1/5","metric":"tbsp","recipe":24}]'

docs.title: Steps
docs.text: POST /api/recipe/int:pk/steps

docs.title: Payload
Parameters
docs.text: name type data type description <int:pk> path (required) int Recipe primary key to which to link the steps

docs.title: Headers
docs.text: name type data type description Authorization required Access Token Token obtained from login endpoint example "token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900" Content-Type application/json `Applicaton Json content header

docs.title: Responses
docs.text: http code content-type response 201 application/json [{recipe.Step object}] 400 application/json {"tag":["Incorrect type. message"]} 401 application/json {"detail":"Authentication credentials were not provided."}

docs.title: Example cURL
docs.text: curl --location 'host/api/recipe/ingredients' --header 'Authorization: token 443c104be8c6daeeaf86df634e69b97668b99900' --data '[{"text":"Heat the oven","recipe":1}]'

docs.text:
